etymologies: mid 18th century; earliest use found in The Gentleman's Magazine. From ancestry + -an

definitions: Of, relating to, or inherited from an ancestor or ancestors; ancestral. In later use specifically: of, relating to, or characteristic of ancestrians.
A member of a group of scientists advocating the explanation of heredity by mathematical calculation of the contributions of successive generations of ancestors.

notes.text: The most prominent members of this group included Francis Galton, Karl Pearson, and Raphael Weldon.
